Job Title: Healthcare Automation Tech Rep Lead Supervisor

Location: Fairdale, KY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
Before you apply to a job, select your language preference from the options available at the top right of this page.

Explore your next opportunity at a Fortune Global 500 organization. Envision innovative possibilities, experience our rewarding culture, and work with talented teams that help you become better every day. We know what it takes to lead UPS into tomorrow—people with a unique combination of skill + passion. If you have the qualities and drive to lead yourself or teams, there are roles ready to cultivate your skills and take you to the next level.

Job Description:

The Healthcare Technology Representative Lead Supervisor serves as a Subject Matter Expert for automation & technology projects, provides support to existing technology and new operations systems, as well as support for new business implementations. He/She gathers business requirements, initiates feasibility studies, and maintains data for larger-scale operation projects, especially those involving technological enhancements. This position serves as a liaison between stakeholders, software engineers, and software users and, therefore, requires a thorough understanding of operations, as well as technology. He/She could coordinate work with other Technology Representative supervisors assigned to the new business or automation implementation.

The Healthcare Technology Representative Lead Supervisor gathers business requirements for system changes and new Implementations to train and manage UAT (User Acceptance Testing) efforts with operations and provide approvals for the Healthcare Life Cycle Management tool. He/She should have a broad knowledge of the cGMP, Smart Solve System, TPL (Technology Project List) application, and UPS's validation processes. Consults with Quality Management Group to provide guidance and supporting data requested during investigation and support of Compliance concerns.

Responsibilities:

Lead Tech Rep on automation testing methodologies and life cyclesConducts survey meetings with stakeholders to clarify business requests and determine the project cost.Develops Business Requirements for New FunctionalityAttends BRD/BRV sessions to gather business requirements.Provide Subject Matter Expertise on Helix and Automation TestingUses experience to determine how innovative technology projects impact operations.Utilizes experience to coordinate inside operations.Utilizes advanced technologies to create operational efficiencies and improve UPS service to customers.Coordinates and collaborates with diverse groups on dangerous goods, DSCSA (Drug Supply Chain Security Act), cold chain, and healthcare/quality requirements.Collaborates with the project team on OMS/WMS configurations (system and hardware).Aids on project deliverables to ensure timelines are met.Assists with validation of planned versus actual task completion to determine project impacts.Distributes project status and timeline reports to identify implementation improvements and future model updates.Supervises Midsize to Large ProjectsSupervises project lifecycles, for UAT scope, resources, schedule, initiation, and deployment to see projects from beginning to end.Assists in the development of project plans (i.e., detailed plan, milestones, and work breakdown structures) and assign tasks to resources to ensure on-time project completion and according to specifications.Ensures affected functions or groups are identified and works with them to negotiate process changes, and ownership of processes, and to manage project impact.Determines employees’ training needs to produce continuous development plans.Resolves individual and group performance issues following UPS’s policies and procedures in a timely manner to motivate and foster teamwork.Conducts User Acceptance TestingCreate test scripts to ensure applications satisfy the business requirements.Reports application defects to IT (Information Technology) to ensure resolution before deployment.Acts as a liaison between IE (Industrial Engineering), IT (Information Technology), Quality & Compliance, business partners, and external clients.Updates the Healthcare Life Cycle Management tool with UAT Dashboard and stakeholder approvals.Conducts application training to provide end users with information on the systems' functionality.Conducts data mining through SQL to use for research and monitoring activities for operations and Quality & Compliance requests.


Qualifications:

Thorough understanding of operations, as well as technology.Broad knowledge of the cGMP, Smart Solve System, TPL (Technology Project List) application, and UPS's validation processes.


Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $75,840/year in our lowest geographic market up to $140,580/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to, market location and may vary depending on job related knowledge, skills, and education/training and a candidate’s work experience. Hired applicants may be eligible for annual short term and/or long-term incentive compensation programs depending on the level of the position. Payments under these annual programs are not guaranteed and are dependent upon a variety of factors including, but not limited to, individual performance, business unit performance, and/or the company’s performance.

This position is eligible for a bonus based on company performance.

Hired applicants may be eligible for Medical/prescription drug coverage, Dental & Vision Benefits, Flexible Spending Account, Health Savings Account, Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account, Basic and Supplemental Life Insurance & Accidental Death and Dismemberment, Disability Income Protection Plan, Employee Assistance Program, Educational Assistance Program, 401(k) retirement program, Vacation, Paid Holidays and Personal time, Paid Sick/Family and Medical Leave time as required by law, Discounted Employee Stock Purchase Program.

Internal Salary Grade: 20F

Deadline to Apply: April 28th, 2024

Employee Type:

Permanent

UPS is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.

Other Criteria: 

Employer will sponsor visas for specific positions. UPS is an equal opportunity employer. UPS does not discriminate on the basis of race/color/religion/sex/national origin/veteran/disability/age/sexual orientation/gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.

Basic Qualifications:

Must be a U.S. Citizen or National of the U.S., an alien lawfully admitted for permanent residence, or an alien authorized to work in the U.S. for this employer.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
